bug.author: aakashbajaj
bug.description:
I am using kfctl binary to generate cluster configuration and deploy kubeflow on GKE. On top of that I am running kubeflow pipelines. Some of the components in my pipeline require high CPU count and thus kubernetes auto-provisions a new node to run the mentioned pod. My components pull images from private GCR repo in same project. But when pod is being deployed on the node, it fails with ErrImagePull error stating authentication error (doesn't have permissions to pull from GCR). The same image when pulled on the GPU pool works fine. I have to give read permissions explicitly to the Node Auto Provisioning Pool: <denchmark-code>gcloud beta container clusters update ${CLUSTER} \ --project ${PROJECT} \ --zone ${ZONE} \ --enable-autoprovisioning \ --max-cpu 20 \ --max-memory 200 \ --max-accelerator type=nvidia-tesla-p100,count=10 \ --verbosity error \ --autoprovisioning-scopes=https://www.googleapis.com/auth/devstorage.read_only </denchmark-code>
After this I am able to deploy pods on auto-provisioned nodes. This should be enabled during the kfclt deployment.
